dcterms:creator: Ryan Lopez
Paul J. Atzberger
dcterms:description: The viscous Burger’s equation is a partial differential equation that describes the evolution of a scalar field under the influence of viscosity. The authors used this dataset to evaluate their method's performance in learning nonlinear dynamics.
dcterms:title: Viscous Burger’s equation

dcterms:creator: Sifan Wang
Hanwen Wang
Paris Perdikaris
dcterms:description: The diffusion-reaction equation describes the behavior of a substance undergoing diffusion and reaction over time. The authors utilized this dataset to assess their method's capability in learning the solution operator of parametric PDEs.
dcterms:title: Diffusion-reaction equation

dcterms:creator: Daniel W. Crews
dcterms:description: The 2-d incompressible Navier-Stokes equation models the flow of incompressible fluids. The authors employed this dataset to demonstrate the effectiveness of their method in learning fluid dynamics.
dcterms:title: 2-d incompressible Navier-Stokes equation

dcterms:creator: Sacha Binder
dcterms:description: The 2-d wave equation describes the propagation of waves in a two-dimensional medium. The authors used this dataset to evaluate their method's performance in learning wave dynamics.
dcterms:title: 2-d wave equation

dcterms:creator: Sacha Binder
dcterms:description: The Burgers’ equation simulation is a one-dimensional model that describes the motion of a viscous fluid. The authors utilized this dataset to assess their method's performance in learning dynamics related to Burgers' equation.
dcterms:title: Burgers’ equation simulation
